intro: Dunalia lycioides f. achalensis, commonly known as the Achalensis variant of the genus Dunalia, is a rare plant species native to specific regions of India. It belongs to the Leguminosae family, characterized by its ability to fix nitrogen through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria. The plant typically features small, clustered flowers that are often pink or purple in color, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. It thrives in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions. Due to its limited distribution and unique botanical traits, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
